content.question: Cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> phosphodiesterase is an enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to a different molecule. Which of the following best predicts the effect of inhibiting cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> phosphodiesterase in a muscle cell stimulated by epinephrine?

choices.label: The concentration of cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease because adenylyl cyclase will no longer be activated.
The G protein will diffuse out of the cell because it will no longer bind to the plasma membrane.
Phosphorylase kinase will remain active because protein kinase A will no longer be deactivated.
Glycolysis will stop because epinephrine signaling will no longer stimulate glycogen breakdown.

content.answer: Phosphorylase kinase will remain active because protein kinase A will no longer be deactivated.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
